knowledgeArticles.snippet: The ServiceNow connector for Glean allows Glean to fetch and index content from Knowledge Articles with metadata including creation details, workflow states, and custom fields

serviceCatalog.snippet: The ServiceNow connector allows Glean to fetch and index Service Catalog items with titles, descriptions, and category organization

tickets.snippet: ITSM incidents with ticket metadata (numbers, descriptions, states, priorities) are supported with additional permissions

newsArticles.snippet: News articles via Content Publishing (titles, headlines, content, publish dates) are indexed

businessApplications.snippet: APM Business Applications and SPM demands, epics, and projects are supported

oauth.snippet: Glean requires authentication by utilizing a dedicated Service Account and OAuth Application

queryTimeEnforcement.snippet: Glean understands all user access permissions and strictly enforces them at the time of the query, ensuring that users cannot see results to which they do not have access

advancedUserCriteria.snippet: Full support via user_criteria_admin role for advanced script-based user criteria

aiAgents.snippet: Configurable AI Agents within Glean support real-world customer service scenariosâ€”such as summarizing tickets, recommending next steps, drafting responses, and creating knowledge base articles

ticketSummarization.snippet: Resolve tickets sooner by quickly diagnosing issues with instant case overviews and recommended actions

responseDrafting.snippet: AI-powered assistance for tailored customer replies and response drafting

knowledgeArticles.snippet: The ServiceNow connector supports knowledge base entities that can be filtered by catalog IDs

serviceCatalog.snippet: You can filter your knowledge base entities by catalog IDs, which lets you selectively ingest only those catalog entities

tickets.snippet: The connector enables two primary write operations: Create a new incident record and Update an existing incident in ServiceNow

realTimeSync.snippet: The connector supports real-time sync, which requires enabling the toggle and providing a client secret value used to verify ServiceNow webhook events

catalogIdFiltering.snippet: You can filter your knowledge base entities by catalog IDs, which lets you selectively ingest only those catalog entities whose catalogSysId matches the filter

urlCustomization.snippet: The ServiceNow connector automatically fetches the url_suffix parameter for your service portal when you grant the connector access to the required ServiceNow tables

queryTimeEnforcement.snippet: The ServiceNow connector uses restrictive access control for the incident entity to enhance security, ensuring that end users can only view incidents with which they are directly associated

knowledgeArticles.snippet: The connector indexes all types of knowledge articles and enables Copilot experiences. It supports indexing content from custom or default knowledge article templates, such as FAQs, How-to, What Is, or KCS article templates. Comments and attachments on KB articles are also indexed. LIMITATION: The connector doesn't support indexing of knowledge blocks and evaluation of their user criteria

serviceCatalog.snippet: The connector indexes 15+ default properties from ServiceNow catalogs including Name, Description, Category, Price, Vendor, Model, Delivery Time, and SysTags

tickets.snippet: The connector indexes ticket records from the task table and its child tables, such as incident, problem, and change_request. However, attachments and comments are NOT indexed

oauth.snippet: OAuth 2.0 authentication is supported with recommended configuration: Refresh Token Lifespan of 31,536,000 seconds (1 year) and Access Token Lifespan of 43,200 seconds (12 hours)

entraId.snippet: Microsoft Entra ID OpenID Connect is supported. Setup requires registering application in Microsoft Entra ID, creating client secret, and retrieving Service Principal Object Identifier via PowerShell

advancedUserCriteria.snippet: The connector supports advanced script-based user criteria permissions in Advanced Flow mode (not enabled by default)

categoryLevelPermissions.snippet: LIMITATION: Category-level permissions are NOT currently read by the connector. Only catalog item-level user criteria are considered

permissionSyncFrequency.snippet: LIMITATION: Incremental crawl only updates changed content, NOT permissions. Identity/permission updates ONLY occur during full crawls

incrementalSync.snippet: Incremental Crawl runs every 15 minutes by default and updates changed content only. However, incremental crawls do NOT update permissions or ACLs

customQueryFilters.snippet: The connector supports custom query filters using ServiceNow's encoded query builder. Default filter: active=true^workflow_state=published. Supports logical operators (AND ^, OR |)

aclEvaluation.snippet: LIMITATION: The connector doesn't evaluate ACL rules for articles, user criteria, or tables. Only user criteria and role-based permissions are supported
